statement.text: Marfan syndrome is an autosomal dominant connective tissue disorder caused by mutations in FBN1 (fibrillin-1 gene) on chromosome 15, affecting approximately 1:5,000 individuals. Cardiovascular manifestations - particularly aortic root dilation and dissection - are the primary cause of reduced life expectancy, making early surveillance and prophylactic surgery essential.
statement.formal: Marfan: AD inheritance, FBN1 mutation (chr15), 1:5000 prevalence; CV manifestations (aortic root dilation, MVP) drive morbidity/mortality

explanation.intuition: Fibrillin-1 is like the scaffolding that holds your blood vessels together. In Marfan syndrome, this scaffolding is defective, so the walls of arteries - especially the aorta - are weaker than normal. Over time, blood pressure slowly stretches these weak walls like an overinflated balloon, particularly at the aortic root where stress is highest.
explanation.key_insight: Marfan syndrome transformed from a uniformly fatal disease (average lifespan 40 years) to near-normal life expectancy with proper surveillance and prophylactic aortic surgery. The key is preventing aortic dissection through early detection and timely intervention.
explanation.technical_details: Fibrillin-1 mutations cause increased TGF-β signaling, leading to elastic fiber fragmentation and cystic medial degeneration. Diagnosis uses revised Ghent criteria (2010): aortic root Z-score ≥2 + ectopia lentis = sufficient; or FBN1 mutation + aortic root Z-score ≥2; or systemic score ≥7 + aortic root Z-score ≥2.

definite_diagnosis: Aortic root Z-score ≥2 AND ectopia lentis
Aortic root Z-score ≥2 AND causal FBN1 mutation
Aortic root Z-score ≥2 AND systemic score ≥7
Ectopia lentis AND causal FBN1 mutation with known aortic involvement

cardiovascular.aortic_root_dilation: Most common and serious - present in 80-90%
cardiovascular.mitral_valve_prolapse: Present in 75%, may cause significant regurgitation
cardiovascular.aortic_dissection: Major cause of death if prophylactic surgery not performed

ocular.ectopia_lentis: Present in 60%, typically superotemporal lens displacement

definition.@value: Autosomal dominant connective tissue disorder due to FBN1 mutation, characterized by aortic root dilation, ectopia lentis, and skeletal features

learning_objectives: Apply Ghent criteria for Marfan diagnosis
Understand the role of FBN1 in aortic pathology
clinical_pearls: Aortic root Z-score ≥2 is the cardiovascular criterion - use Z-scores, not absolute measurements in young patients
25% of cases are de novo mutations - no family history doesn't exclude diagnosis
Beta-blockers and losartan slow aortic root dilation
Life expectancy is near-normal with proper surveillance and timely surgery
